00006 // This function returns a string containing the substring of the input string
00007 // determined by the starting index and count of characters.
00008 //
00009 // AngelScript signature:
00010 // string@ substring(const string &in str, int start, int count)
00011 void StringSubString_Generic(asIScriptGeneric *gen)
00012 {
00013     // Get the arguments
00014     CScriptString *str = *(CScriptString**)gen->GetAddressOfArg(0);
00015     int start = *(int*)gen->GetAddressOfArg(1);
00016     int count = *(int*)gen->GetAddressOfArg(2);
00017 
00018     // Create the substring
00019     CScriptString *sub = new CScriptString();
00020     sub->buffer = str->buffer.substr(start,count);
00021 
00022     // Return the substring
00023     *(CScriptString**)gen->GetReturnPointer() = sub;
00024 }
00025

00027 
00028 // This function returns the index of the first position where the substring
00029 // exists in the input string. If the substring doesn't exist in the input
00030 // string -1 is returned.
00031 //
00032 // AngelScript signature:
00033 // int findFirst(const string &in str, const string &in sub, int start)
00034 void StringFindFirst_Generic(asIScriptGeneric *gen)
00035 {
00036     // Get the arguments
00037     CScriptString *str = *(CScriptString**)gen->GetAddressOfArg(0);
00038     CScriptString *sub = *(CScriptString**)gen->GetAddressOfArg(1);
00039     int start = *(int*)gen->GetAddressOfArg(2);
00040 
00041     // Find the substring
00042     int loc = (int)str->buffer.find(sub->buffer, start);
00043 
00044     // Return the result
00045     *(int*)gen->GetReturnPointer() = loc;
00046 }

00053

00056 
00057     // Return the result
00058     *(int*)gen->GetReturnPointer() = loc;
00059 }

00097 // This function returns the index of the first character that is in

00099 // returned.
00100 //
00101 // AngelScript signature:

00103 void StringFindFirstOf_Generic(asIScriptGeneric *gen)
00104 {

00106     CScriptString *str = *(CScriptString**)gen->GetAddressOfArg(0);
00107     CScriptString *chars = *(CScriptString**)gen->GetAddressOfArg(1);
00108     int start = *(int*)gen->GetAddressOfArg(2);
00109 
00110     // Find the substring
00111     int loc = (int)str->buffer.find_first_of(chars->buffer, start);
00112 
00113     // Return the result
00114     *(int*)gen->GetReturnPointer() = loc;
00115 }

00232 // This function takes an input string and splits it into parts by looking
00233 // for a specified delimiter. Example:
00234 //
00235 // string str = "A|B||D";
00236 // string@[]@ array = split(str, "|");
00237 //
00238 // The resulting array has the following elements:
00239 //
00240 // {"A", "B", "", "D"}
00241 //
00242 // AngelScript signature:
00243 // string@[]@ split(const string &in str, const string &in delim)
00244 void StringSplit_Generic(asIScriptGeneric *gen)
00245 {
00246     // Obtain a pointer to the engine
00247     asIScriptContext *ctx = asGetActiveContext();
00248     asIScriptEngine *engine = ctx->GetEngine();
00249 
00250     // TODO: This should only be done once
00251     int stringArrayType = engine->GetTypeIdByDecl("string@[]");
00252 
00253     // Create the array object
00254     asIScriptArray *array = (asIScriptArray*)engine->CreateScriptObject(stringArrayType);
00255 
00256     // Get the arguments
00257     CScriptString *str = *(CScriptString**)gen->GetAddressOfArg(0);
00258     CScriptString *delim = *(CScriptString**)gen->GetAddressOfArg(1);
00259 
00260     // Find the existence of the delimiter in the input string
00261     int pos = 0, prev = 0, count = 0;
00262     while( (pos = (int)str->buffer.find(delim->buffer, prev)) != (int)std::string::npos )
00263     {
00264         // Add the part to the array
00265         CScriptString *part = new CScriptString();
00266         part->buffer.assign(&str->buffer[prev], pos-prev);
00267         array->Resize(array->GetElementCount()+1);
00268         *(CScriptString**)array->GetElementPointer(count) = part;
00269 
00270         // Find the next part
00271         count++;
00272         prev = pos + (int)delim->buffer.length();
00273     }
00274 
00275     // Add the remaining part
00276     CScriptString *part = new CScriptString();
00277     part->buffer.assign(&str->buffer[prev]);
00278     array->Resize(array->GetElementCount()+1);
00279     *(CScriptString**)array->GetElementPointer(count) = part;
00280 
00281     // Return the array by handle
00282     *(asIScriptArray**)gen->GetReturnPointer() = array;
00283 }

00286 
00287 // This function takes as input an array of string handles as well as a
00288 // delimiter and concatenates the array elements into one delimited string.
00289 // Example:
00290 //
00291 // string@[] array = {"A", "B", "", "D"};
00292 // string str = join(array, "|");
00293 //
00294 // The resulting string is:
00295 //
00296 // "A|B||D"
00297 //
00298 // AngelScript signature:
00299 // string@ join(const string@[] &in array, const string &in delim)
00300 void StringJoin_Generic(asIScriptGeneric *gen)
00301 {
00302     // Get the arguments
00303     asIScriptArray *array = *(asIScriptArray**)gen->GetAddressOfArg(0);
00304     CScriptString *delim = *(CScriptString**)gen->GetAddressOfArg(1);
00305 
00306     // Create the new string
00307     CScriptString *str = new CScriptString();
00308     int n;
00309     for( n = 0; n < (int)array->GetElementCount() - 1; n++ )
00310     {
00311         CScriptString *part = *(CScriptString**)array->GetElementPointer(n);
00312         str->buffer += part->buffer;
00313         str->buffer += delim->buffer;
00314     }
00315 
00316     // Add the last part
00317     CScriptString *part = *(CScriptString**)array->GetElementPointer(n);
00318     str->buffer += part->buffer;
00319 
00320     // Return the string
00321     *(CScriptString**)gen->GetReturnPointer() = str;
00322 }

00326 // This is where the utility functions are registered.
00327 // The string type must have been registered first.
00328 void RegisterScriptStringUtils(asIScriptEngine *engine)
00329 {
00330     int r;
00331 
00332     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("string@ substring(const string &in, int, int)", asFUNCTION(StringSubString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00333     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findFirst(const string &in, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(StringFindFirst0_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00334     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findFirst(const string &in, const string &in, int)", asFUNCTION(StringFindFirst_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00335     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findLast(const string &in, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(StringFindLast0_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00336     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findLast(const string &in, const string &in, int)", asFUNCTION(StringFindLast_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00337     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findFirstOf(const string &in, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(StringFindFirstOf0_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00338     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findFirstOf(const string &in, const string &in, int)", asFUNCTION(StringFindFirstOf_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00339     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findFirstNotOf(const string &in, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(StringFindFirstNotOf0_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00340     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findFirstNotOf(const string &in, const string &in, int)", asFUNCTION(StringFindFirstNotOf_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00341     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findLastOf(const string &in, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(StringFindLastOf0_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00342     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findLastOf(const string &in, const string &in, int)", asFUNCTION(StringFindLastOf_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00343     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findLastNotOf(const string &in, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(StringFindLastNotOf0_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00344     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("int findLastNotOf(const string &in, const string &in, int)", asFUNCTION(StringFindLastNotOf_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00345     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("string@[]@ split(const string &in, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(StringSplit_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00346     r = engine->RegisterGlobalFunction("string@ join(const string@[] &in, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(StringJoin_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert(r >= 0);
00347 }
